head.title: World Business Briefing | Americas: Brazil: Order For Jets

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Americas: Brazil: Order For Jets

abstract.p: Gol Transportes Aereos, fastest-growing Brazilian budget airline, places order for up to 43 passenger jets from Boeing Co; list price on order is $960 million, and final price tag could rise to $2.7 billion if Gol exercises all options (S)

block.p: Gol Transportes Aéreos, the fast-growing Brazilian budget airline, said it had placed an order for up to 43 passenger jets from the Boeing Company. The deal includes firm orders for 15 Boeing 737-800's, with deliveries starting in 2007, and gives Gol the option to purchase 28 more by 2010. The list price on the order is $960 million, and the final price tag could rise to $2.7 billion if Gol exercises all the options. The deal is the first time the privately owned Gol has sought to buy its own aircraft.

Gol Transportes Aéreos, the fast-growing Brazilian budget airline, said it had placed an order for up to 43 passenger jets from the Boeing Company. The deal includes firm orders for 15 Boeing 737-800's, with deliveries starting in 2007, and gives Gol the option to purchase 28 more by 2010. The list price on the order is $960 million, and the final price tag could rise to $2.7 billion if Gol exercises all the options. The deal is the first time the privately owned Gol has sought to buy its own aircraft.
